title: OGRA launches “Plant for Pakistan” initiative
content:
ISLAMABAD, Aug 13 (APP):In commemoration of Pakistan’s 78th Independence Day, the Oil and Gas Regulatory Authority (OGRA) on Tuesday launched the “Plant for Pakistan” initiative, reflecting the nation’s commitment to combating the adverse impacts of climate change.
The eco-friendly drive was inaugurated by OGRA Chairman, Masroor Khan, who planted a tree alongside Members of the Authority and OGRA employees.
The initial phase saw the planting of over 200 trees on the green belt in front of the OGRA Headquarters in Islamabad, in collaboration with the Capital Development Authority (CDA).
Chairman Masroor Khan commended the Capital Development Authority for its support during the drive. He emphasized the importance of collective efforts in safeguarding the environment, stating, “As we celebrate our Independence Day, let us pledge to serve our nation with dedication and to protect our environment from the dangers of climate change. Together, we can make a difference by planting as many trees as possible.”
Masroor Khan also called upon all OGRA licensees to actively participate in the “Plant for Pakistan” drive, reinforcing the organization’s commitment to environmental sustainability.
